title: LobeHug: A Product made by Generative AI
text:
We‚Äôre excited to unveil LobeHug ‚Äì the latest innovation in clasp earrings that offer comfort without the need for piercing. After consulting with the advanced AI of ChatGPT 4, we‚Äôve crafted a name and a product that embodies elegance and ease: LobeHug.



Simple and Elegant: Easy to say, write, and remember.
Unique: Stands out in the earring industry.
Memorable: Short enough to stick in your mind.
Visually Appealing: The name itself is as attractive as the product.
Affectionate: Conveys the feeling of a soft, gentle embrace for your earlobes.








Embrace your ears with the tender touch of LobeHug clasp earrings. Our expertly crafted earrings are designed for those who seek the sophistication of fine jewelry without the commitment of a piercing.
Each pair of LobeHug earrings features a gentle, secure clasp that ensures all-day comfort and a snug fit for any earlobe. Made with hypoallergenic materials, LobeHug earrings are suitable for sensitive skin, allowing style to be free from discomfort.
With LobeHug, accessorizing any outfit becomes effortless, adding a touch of class to your everyday look. Experience the fusion of fashion and convenience, and give your lobes the affection they‚Äôve been missing.
Key Features:

Hypoallergenic material for sensitive skin
Secure and comfortable clasp design
Elegant styles to complement any wardrobe
No piercing required






üåü Introducing LobeHug! üåü
Say goodbye to the pinch of piercings and hello to effortless style with our newest collection of clasp earrings. LobeHug earrings are set to revolutionize your accessory game with a gentle embrace that‚Äôs kind to your skin. Perfect for all-day wear, whether you‚Äôre a fashion enthusiast who values comfort or someone who prefers not to pierce, LobeHug is for you.
Swipe to see our dazzling designs ‚û°Ô∏è Tap to shop! üõçÔ∏è
#LobeHug #ClaspEarrings #NoPierceAllGlam #EarLove #JewelryRevolution



[Scene: A woman is getting ready for a day out. She looks at her reflection in the mirror and smiles.]
Voiceover: ‚ÄúIntroducing LobeHug - the earrings that embrace your lobes without a single pinch.‚Äù
[The woman selects a pair of LobeHug earrings from a beautifully arranged jewelry box.]
Voiceover: ‚ÄúFor the style-savvy, the comfort-conscious, and everyone in between, LobeHug is here to adorn your ears with the utmost care.‚Äù
[Close-up of the LobeHug earrings clasping securely onto the woman‚Äôs earlobes.]
Voiceover: ‚ÄúOur unique clasp design ensures a comfortable fit, perfect for wearing from day to night. Crafted with love and attention to detail, LobeHug earrings are the accessory you‚Äôve been waiting for.‚Äù
[The woman heads out, confident and radiant, her LobeHug earrings catching the light.]
Voiceover: ‚ÄúNo piercings? No problem. LobeHug is all about celebrating you - just the way you are. Get ready to feel the gentle hug of LobeHug earrings and join the revolution of elegance and ease.‚Äù
[The LobeHug logo appears on screen with a tagline.]
Voiceover: ‚ÄúLobeHug - Where comfort meets chic. Available now.‚Äù

Based on these detailed descriptions, imagine our product, LobeHug, as a set of beautifully crafted earrings with a sleek and modern design. The clasp mechanism is both sophisticated and discreet, ensuring that the earrings look seamless and elegant on the earlobes. The materials shine with a lustrous finish, indicating high-quality craftsmanship, and the overall aesthetic is one of understated luxury that complements any outfit with a whisper of grace.

title: A test post
text:
Read the following and see if you can answer the question:


There are three boxes in a stack. A pink one, a purple one and a green one. The pink one is in the middle of the stack with the purple below it. What is the color of the box on the bottom of the stack?

Most likely you answered purple‚Ä¶
But it is possible you first said green (don‚Äôt worry if you did it is quite a common response!)


It‚Äôs a verbal visual problem that requires some deliberation and most likely for us to create a visual image of a stack of boxes as a reasoning aid.
Notice also the complexity of the language used in the prompt to describe the scene. The use of natural language as opposed to a formal/logical calculus does hold the potential for ambiguity (multiple interpretations) and inexactness. However, it is the most normal/natural, efficient and broadly accessible way of communicating such information.
Notice 1. The use of anaphor or reference. - Three BOXES -> a pink/purple/green ONE as opposed to a pink box, a purple box and a green box. - The PINK ONE is in the middle ... the purple {BOX} below IT {the pink box}
We tend to try and avoid this kind of repetition to make our speech more coherent.

Although the description in language may not be entirely concise, there is no real ambiguity as to how the boxes can be arranged. It must be: | Box | Stack position | | ‚Äî | ‚Äî | | GREEN | top | | PINK | middle | | PURPLE | bottom |




GPT3.5 Turbo

Had some difficulties and answered green
Llama2 (chat 7B version)


Answered correctly (purple) and used some so-called chain-of-thought reasoning

Bing Chat (MS Co-pilot)
This LLM is GPT4 with some Microsoft specific tuning and RAG (search) additions.
It get‚Äôs it correct:

The color of the box on the bottom of the stack is purple. This is because the purple box is below the pink one, which is in the middle of the stack. Therefore, the purple box must be the lowest one. üü™

But when you follow up and ask it to create visual representation of the box arrangement

PROMPT: Can you create a visual representation of how the boxes are arranged?

It responds

RESPONSE: Sure, I‚Äôll try to create that. Here is a visual representation of how the boxes are arranged:

And uses DALL-E3 to create 4 different attempts at a visual representation:

NONE OF WHICH ARE CORRECT!!!

title: About
text: About this blog Here are some experiments looking at LLMs as communicators

title: Lucas as a Real HouseHusband
text:
In the world of marketing, understanding one‚Äôs personal brand is as crucial as any product or company branding. For a recent assignment in my marketing class, I embarked on an introspective journey to compare my personal identity with the image perceived by others. The project required me to gather feedback from friends, family, and peers, asking them to describe me in five words and to identify positive attributes they believe I lack.


The responses from the 14 participants, a blend of those closest to me, painted an overwhelmingly positive picture of my personal image. People see me as sociable, outgoing, humorous, caring, and wise. Descriptors like ‚Äúoutgoing,‚Äù ‚Äútalkative,‚Äù and ‚Äúpersonable‚Äù suggest I am at ease in social situations and adaptable to various people and contexts. With frequent mentions of ‚Äúfunny,‚Äù ‚Äúwitty,‚Äù ‚Äúcomical,‚Äù and ‚Äúsassy,‚Äù it‚Äôs evident that my sense of humor is a highlight among my social circles.
Beyond humor, I am recognized as a supportive friend and family member, with terms such as ‚Äúlistener,‚Äù ‚Äúthoughtful,‚Äù ‚Äúcaring,‚Äù and ‚Äúempathetic‚Äù used to characterize me. Being referred to as ‚Äúwise‚Äù signals that others see me as a source of advice, while ‚Äúgenuine,‚Äù ‚Äúloyal,‚Äù ‚Äúbubbly,‚Äù ‚Äúamazing,‚Äù and ‚Äújoyful‚Äù confirm that my positive energy and good character do not go unnoticed.


Interestingly, the exercise also revealed what I am not. Words like ‚Äúpatient,‚Äù ‚Äúrelaxed,‚Äù and ‚Äúunbothered‚Äù indicate that I may come across as a dynamic individual who reacts keenly to my surroundings, sometimes hastily or with a hot temper. The feedback suggests that I am not always the calmest or most punctual person, which aligns with my self-admitted poor texting habits.




As a big reality TV fan, fantasizing about being on a show like ‚ÄúThe Real Housewives‚Äù is a fun diversion. With the insights from my assignment, I prompted an AI tool to create a Real Housewives tagline for me. The result was spot-on:
‚ÄúIn the game of life, I‚Äôm not just playing‚ÄîI‚Äôm playing to win.‚Äù ‚ÄúLoyal to my roots and fiery to the core, when I step into the room, I bring the heat without missing a beat!‚Äù



Curiosity led me to ask the AI which Real Housewife I resemble the most, and the answer was Teresa Giudice from ‚ÄúThe Real Housewives of New Jersey.‚Äù The comparison was drawn based on our shared Italian American heritage, fiery personalities, warmth, humor, struggles with vulnerability, and occasional unresponsiveness.



Conversely, the AI suggested that I am least like Lisa Vanderpump of ‚ÄúThe Real Housewives of Beverly Hills,‚Äù citing her calm and poised demeanor, emotional reservation, strategic approach to relationships, British formality, and a lifestyle focused on business and philanthropy.



The AI‚Äôs focus on my Italian American identity in these comparisons is intriguing. It highlights the cultural aspects of my persona, contrasting them with the British reserve of Lisa Vanderpump, while underscoring the similarities with Teresa Giudice‚Äôs vivacious Italian energy.



This assignment and the playful exploration with AI have not only provided a deeper understanding of how others perceive me but also allowed me to see myself through the lens of a reality TV archetype. In the realm of personal branding, these insights are invaluable, and the journey has been both enlightening and entertaining.
Lucas Brienza Italian American, Fiery, and Ready for Reality TV Stardom
